title: Un written rules in making a stencil?
content:
Hey experts ...

I’m gonna make a stencil type-face as a brand for a museum - and was wondering if there are any unwritten rules when you make a stencil typeface?

Must and don’ts !?!?

thx

 [‹ Job Posting - Hoefler & Frere-Jones](http://web.archive.org/web/20081029024331/http:/typophile.com/node/49857 "Go to previous forum topic") ["Dutch Type" Book by Jan Middendorp ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081029024331/http:/typophile.com/node/45010 "Go to next forum topic")
author: monefeldt

comments.content: Keep in mind the reasoning behind how real stencils work - the “breaks” in the letters exist only to keep the counters from flopping around.

also, watch the spacing between letters; when used with spraypaint you never get a flush connection with the surface (either due to time, or the medium) causing a lot of bleed...obviously if they only exist in a digital enviroment it’s all good.
